name: Hit
desc: Everyone who starts training in the Academies will learn to make this basic attack form with melee weapons. There is nothing fancy about the skill but it will do its job.

name: Shoot
desc: Most commoners know how to use a bow and as such there is nothing impressive about the Shoot skill. It is nice to know, though!

name: Magic Coat
desc: This spell creates a shimmering force around the caster's body that acts more or less like a suit of body. The force will absorb a small amount of damage caused by weapons, thus offering the caster slightly better protection versus attacks.

name: Zap
desc: The Zap spell is the most elemental Bane spell that is taught in the magic Towers in the towns and cities of Eidolon. The spell releases a ray of raw energy that the caster accumulates when speaking the incantation.

name: Move
desc: Moving around in the Arena is quite simple and you should have no trouble doing this...just beware of the traps that might have been placed by your foes!

name: Dodge
desc: Dodging is the primary defence skill taught in the Academies. It is simple and fast to learn but will only make you slightly harder to hit. This type of skill was invented by a long gone order of pacifists.

name: Blink
desc: Blink is the most unstable spell in the line of translocations spells. Because of the speed with which this spell is cast it may sometimes fizzle - mainly because the caster messes up with the incantation. However, when it works it will teleport the caster to a random location in the Arena.

name: Minor Cure
desc: By the use of this spell a number of magical bandages appear and they will automatically wrap themselves around any wound the caster may have suffered. Of course, the spell is only effective against small wounds and scratches!

name: Shift
desc: Unsatisfied with the somewhat unstable Blink spell the masters of the Tower of Orumant invented this spell, which is just an upgraded version. This spell will fizzle less but the caster still has no influence on where he will be teleported to.

name: Ghost Walk
desc: Now this is more like it! By making use of the Ghost Walk the caster may teleport to a location that he selects himself - so no more random teleportation here! The downside of the spell, though, is that there is a slight chance that it will fizzle.

name: Wraith Walk
desc: Just like Ghost Walking this spell will allow the caster to magically move to a different location in a matter of seconds. This spell is even better than the sister version in that it will not fizzle as often as Ghost Walk.

name: Lower Will
desc: This spell is made for penetrating the opponent's spell resistance so that the spells that follow, like a nasty Fireball, don't go to waste being resisted.

name: Evil Eye
desc: The Evil Eye will cause the foe to miss more often than usual.

name: Plague
desc: Cast Plague on your foe and his attacks will cause less damage.

name: Dispel Magic
desc: Dispel Magic is one of those spells that have a nasty habit of fizzling in just the wrong moment, namely when you most need it to work. When the spell actually works, which is most of the time after all, it cancels Invisibility and Holy Aura.

name: Attraction
desc: If you are confident in your own close quarter abilities then you should really employ this spell as it will draw your opponent closer. This may interrupt his own move actions, causing an otherwise great battle plan to crumble!

name: Confusion
desc: If your foe tries to move under the influence of this spell he will not be able to control where to go and will thus move in random directions.

name: Fear
desc: It's about time your foes fear you properly! They will litterally run away from you now.

name: Construct
desc: Tired of all the destruction? Then use this spell to increase the size of obstacles.

name: Double Zap
desc: Once the old masters of the Towers learned how to harness the raw energy of a basic Zap spell they soon learned to increase the power. The result was the Double Zap spell that releases two rays instead of one.

name: Hand of Pain
desc: The force of this close range spell is that it will often take the opponent by surprise. The reason for this is that it isn't that obvious that a spell is being cast - it simply looks like the caster is trying to grab the opponent. However, when the Hand of Pain touches a person it will drain a small amount of Life from the victim.

name: Big Zap
desc: This is the most powerful version of the spell category that is based upon releasing raw energy. Unlike the Double Zap spell the Big Zap is just one large bolt of energy that is so powerful that it will even melt soft metals.

name: Ice Kiss
desc: When someone tries to kiss you, you would hardly suspect that they mean to harm you. This spell exploits this as it delivers a powerful draining effect through a kiss, often rendering the victim numb or slain on the ground. Off course, using the spell in the Arena may often give the opponent a clue as to your intentions.

name: Sticky Fire
desc: Having seen the impressive effect of the varios fire bomb types the masters of the Towers soon realised that a spell with similar effects would be very potent indeed. The first result in the line of fire spells is this spell, which engulfs the victim in sticky, burning plasma.

name: Clawkill
desc: When using this spell the caster's main hand transforms into a large, sharp claw. If used against an opponent like a melee weapon the claw will cause great damage.

name: Inferno
desc: Inferno is a much favoured spell by those who fight in the Arenas. The spell was invented by a crazy wizard of Vulcor who ended his days in prison accused for many accounts of arson. Rumour has it that the wizard said that he was communicating with dragons and that the reptilians would one day free him...obviously they never did.

name: Drainhand
desc: This spell was originally thought up by mages that believed that they could create a spell that caused damage to a foe and transferred the life energy to the caster of the spell. The result was not exactly what they hoped for, but at least it is still a potent damage spell!

name: Lightning
desc: It may not come as SHOCKING news to you that Lightnings are quite dangerous. With this spell you have the advantage of being able to blast your opponent away from a safe distance.

name: Fireball
desc: As the name implies this spell produces a deadly Fireball that explodes when it hits its target.

name: Lethal Claw
desc: Lethal Claw is a much more potent version of the Clawkill spell. One of the main ingredients is a claw from one of the huge trolls that roam the wastes of Vulcor. Unfortunately the claw must be taken from a living troll, which makes it much harder to come by.

name: Ice Field
desc: You must select a field for this spell to target but the damage caused is tremendous. Note that it still requires line of sight!

name: Paralyze
desc: Your foe will move slower than normal when you use this spell.

name: Fire Dart
desc: Fry your foe from within with this Fire Dart and watch him dance in pain.

name: Spell Stop
desc: The foe's first spell will be cancelled. That'll teach those wizards a lesson!

name: Poison Acid
desc: Here's a nasty trick as the foe will suffer right away but also at the end of the turn.

name: Fire Field
desc: Select a target field and watch your foe be toasted by the roaring fire in the blast.

name: Ghosthand
desc: This spell will ignore some of the foe's armour and almost go right through.

name: Blur Body
desc: This Guardian spell improves the caster's chance of avoiding getting hit by attacks made with weapons by partly transferring the caster's body to another plane of existence. The spell will stack with defence skills if used in the same turn.

name: Mind Block
desc: Mind Block is a spell that the former head master of the Tower of Orumant invented as a means to improve magic resistance. Ironically he died in a horrible explosion that was caused by a Fireball spell that somehow went wrong.

name: Runic Vest
desc: This spell works on the same principles as Magic Coat but the force surrounding the caster is slightly stronger and will absorb more damage.

name: Ghost Body
desc: Inspired by an encounter with a ghostly humanoid shape near one of the stone circles in the deep forest of Mystor, one of the master of the Tower in Ravarcil invented this spell. The spell makes the caster's body appear semi transparent.

name: Brain Shield
desc: This spell creates a magical barrier around the caster's brain that effectively increases the chances of resisting spells. The barrier creates a slight tingle, but not so much as to become unbearable.

name: Spell Armour
desc: With this spell the effect of heavy armour is more or less duplicated. However, since the spell is based on a force field it should only be used in fights as it may also prevent other things than weapons to get to the caster...like a keg of beer!

name: Celestial Body
desc: Under the influence of a Celestial Body spell the caster becomes ethereal for a short period of time, making it harder for opponents to hit with weapons.

name: Mental Wall
desc: Unlike the Brain Shield this spell creates a big, invisible magic wall around the caster. The wall acts as a obstacle for spells and will make it easier for the caster to resist hostile spells.

name: Stoneskin
desc: Even today it is unknown who invented this spell that is an improved version of Spell Armour. Some say that it must have been a former master of the Tower of Dagonar while others claim that its origins can be traced back to Mystor. No matter what, the spell offers great protection against enemy attacks!

name: Blurry
desc: Avoiding being hit becomes so much easier if this spell is used. The caster's body will appear as a blurry form to the enemy making it harder to direct attacks at the right places.

name: Invisibility
desc: You will be invisible for the rest of the turn unless you do anything else but Move.

name: Baneguard
desc: This is a good way to increase your chances of resisting spells.

name: Reflect Pain
desc: If this spell doesn't fizzle the damage caused by the foe's next weapon attack is reflected.

name: Mental Armour
desc: This reduces the damage of spells cast at you so it's almost like armour.

name: Spell Block
desc: This spell will block the foe's next spell. But know that this spell may fizzle.

name: Vanish
desc: You will be almost 100% safe from the foe's targeting for as long as you only move.

name: Reflect Spell
desc: Use this spell to deflect the foe's Bane spells so it will harm him instead of you.

name: Holy Aura
desc: You will be totally immune to damage 2 times if this spell doesn't fizzle!

name: Medium Cure
desc: As an improved version of Minor Cure this spells allows for greater healing and may even be used to re-attach small body parts like toes and fingers.

name: Strong Cure
desc: This spell is said to be based on the same type of divine magic that the queens have enchanted the Arenas with so that heroes cannot die while training. If this is true it is obviously far less potent than the magic used by the queens.

name: Power Cure
desc: Conjuring a vortex of energy from nearby plants and elements, this spell can potentially heal even gaping wounds. The visual effects of the spell are just as spectacular as magical bandages that look like bands of shimmering light are wrapped around the caster's wounds.

name: Repair Wound
desc: Even though the Heal Wound spell is more difficult to cast, the healing potential of this spell exceeds it slightly. The reason that Repair Wound is easier to learn and does not require as much willpower to control is that the result is somewhat random.

name: Heal Wound
desc: With this spell the caster will know just how much he can count on being healed. Ever since the spell was invented by a priest of Mystor it has saved many a hero from dying on the battlefield.

name: Super Heal
desc: This spell is even better than the Heal Wound spell and though it could possibly turn the tide of great battles only few ever get to cast it because it requires so much willpower to control the divine force that is needed.

name: Neutralize
desc: In addition to healing you a bit this spell makes you immune to Poison Acid.

name: Bless
desc: Holy guidance leads your hand and your attacks will cause more damage.

name: Rain of Life
desc: This provides instant healing as well as at the end of the turn but is a rather slow spell.

name: Bravery
desc: This spell counters the effects of the Fear, Confusion and Attraction spells.

name: Mystic Hand
desc: Your attacks will hit much better when they are guided by this spell.

name: Wait
desc: Waiting can sometimes be a useful thing to do if you are not sure what your enemy is going to do. Use this tactical element to make your nasty attacks or spells come in at the exact right time.

name: Panic
desc: Sometimes it is better to leave things to fate and hope that it works out okay. By deliberately working up a Panic, a skill tought be the masters of the Academies, you may increase your move speed. The downside is that you have no control over where you end up once your combination of jumps, rolls and sprints is over!

name: Tiptoe
desc: Tiptoeing is useful when you must sneak home from a late visit to the local Tavern and don't want to wake up the wife. However, it may also save your life if you use the skill in the Arena because when Tiptoeing you don't trigger any traps.

name: Disarm Trap
desc: Disarming a trap is only for those with the right skill...and this is it! Instead of just hoping that you will not step on a trap you can use this skill to completely remove a trap that has been planted. Note that you will first have to guess where the traps might be hidden.

name: Zig Zag
desc: When you move in Zig-Zag it will take you longer to get from A to B than when moving normally. However, you will be harder to hit with weapons for your foe.

name: Back Away
desc: This is a more controlled form of Panic as you will only move away from the foe.

name: Run
desc: Running allows you to move faster but you will be easier to affect with spells.

name: Tumble
desc: Tumble allows you to move through enemy fields. But you can still not end in same field.

name: Deflect
desc: By using a weapon or your armour this skill allows you to deflect incoming attacks.

name: Evade
desc: With this skill you will be able to read your foes next move the second before he performs it. This means that you sometimes can move out of the way and take no damage at all making your opponent look silly.

name: Slide
desc: Sliding is a more advanced skill based on the same principles as Evading and Doging and it will make it very hard for opponents to hit you with weapons.

name: Parry
desc: The Parry skill is based on blocking attacks with your own weapon.

name: Arrowshield
desc: Great for avoiding arrows but not very clever to use in close combat!

name: Meditate
desc: While Meditating you will be easier to hit with weapons but will resist spells easier.

name: Bomb Cover
desc: If your foe keeps hurling bombs at you then use this skill and you will only take half damage.

name: Counterstrike
desc: If you avoid the foe's attack with this skill you will also make an automatic counter hit.

name: Aimed Hit
desc: With this skill the focus is on precision rather than speed. Use this form of attack if your opponent is hard to hit as it will improve your chance of winning.

name: Whip Hit
desc: The name of this skill does not reflect the weapon used but rather describes the speed with with it is performed. It is fast but not as accurate as an Aimed Hit.

name: Place Trap
desc: If you plan on using any of the deadly traps that are available in the world of Eidolon then this skill is a must. It allows you to place a trap in the field that you are in when you use the skill. Note that some other skills can be learned to overcome traps!

name: Nerve Hit
desc: Many would argue that this somewhat shady form of attack should be banned in the Arenas but that has yet to happen. The skill is taught by former assassins that know how to target vital nerves for great effect!

name: Power Hit
desc: Sheer power is the secret of this skill! Considering the amount of time this skill takes to learn is itsn't that accurate. But don't worry, when you hit your foe they are sure to feel that you mean business!

name: Impair
desc: Hitting the foe with this skill will reduce his chance of hitting you next time.

name: Slow
desc: The foe will move slower if you hit with this attack skill.

name: Whirlwind
desc: This attack will cause a minimum of damage but it's very fast indeed!

name: Rage Hit
desc: You won't hit that well with this skill but at least you will make 2 fast attacks in a row.

name: Berserk
desc: Forget about defence! This is an all out attack skill and you will go right for your foe in melee.

name: Demolish
desc: Are you annoyed by the obstacles? Then reduce their size or completely remove the small ones!

name: Blindfight
desc: You won't hit that often with this skill but you will even be able to hit Invisible foes.

name: Head Blow
desc: If this attack hits it will cause a lot of damage and the foe's spells may actually fizzle!

name: Pierce Hit
desc: With this skill you don't have to worry about foes in big suits of armour.

name: Snapshot
desc: Basically, a Snapshot is a fast variant of the basic Shoot skill and it will allow you to increase your rate of fire while only sacrificing a little accuracy

name: Toss Bomb
desc: Tossing a bomb would be suicide if you didn't master this skill, especially considering how dangerous some of the bombs of Eidolon are even to the one using them!

name: Snipe
desc: Like an Aimed Hit the Snipe skill is based on accuracy. It is the pride of the famous huntsmen of Mystor and is only those who are deemed worthy are taught the skill.

name: Double Shot
desc: Long training is required to learn the special skill of firing two arrows at the same time. However, once learned you will quick discover the damage potential of the extra arrow that hits your opponent.

name: Arm Shot
desc: Shoot the foe in the arm and his next attack will have a hard time hitting you.

name: Leg Shot
desc: With an arrow in the leg your foe won't move as far as normal.

name: Turbo Shot
desc: Yes, you will be able to shoot very fast but you won't cause much damage.

name: Arrow Burst
desc: Two arrows are fired in a row but the chance of hitting is rather low.

name: Power Shot
desc: This type of shot may be slow? but boy does it hurt!

name: True Shot
desc: This type of shot may even target invisible foes.

name: Fizzle Shot
desc: This shot may cause the foe's next spell to fizzle but it has a low chance of hitting.
